question.0: What is the penetration of dental scanners in the sample of dental laboratories?
question.1: What percentage of european partner lab users also send their models or scan files to a manufacturer/milling center?

0: chart reasons to use: scanners - europe the most quoted reasons to use mentioned by the sample of dental practices are quite different from those quoted by the dental laboratories. among the dental practices prevails the ease of use and the comfort, either it be for the patients or for the dentists themselves. only later on come the innovation and the precision of the system. on the other hand, among the sample of dental laboratories, the quality of the restorations and the range of procedures available prevail, that is, first come quality and key-stone omnivision digital europe 2015_executive_summary - 32 flexibility. also, the responses from the laboratories make understand that the increase in the productivity is felt to be an important feature that the digital technologies have to bring.

ease of use higher than average in the uk (27%). accuracy is higher than average in bigger labs (60%), and among labs producing orthodontic aligners (57%). labo the main perceived benefits are related to the improvement of the workflow. in fact, the main items relate to simplification of the workflow, increased accuracy of scanned files and therefore increased productivity in the laboratory. in italy there is a greater perception of increased productivity, while in the uk and france the perception is greater for the accuracy of scans. base: 594 cases doctor digitization impact on laboratory staff do you feel that doctor digitization with intra oral scanners has had an impact on your laboratory staff? 40 digitization with the intraoral scanner has a positive impact on the laboratory staff according to 60% of the sample. the phenomenon is most relevant in uk (70%). the impact is more present on big labs (72%) and, generally speaking, among all labs experiencing a higher-than-average involvement in the digital workflow. the opposite is true for smaller sized labs (51% for yes) and in general for those labs not highly involved in the digital workflow. more recently open labs do see a more frequent impact (76%), while the opposite is true for less recently open ones (52%). labs producing a higher number of cases of fixed prosthetics (70%) or ortho cases with aligners (71%) do quote yes more than average. labo the impact on the laboratory staff is linked to the increased productivity and staff involvement. in italy, there is a greater perception of an increased need for staff training. higher than average quotes for increased training needs (89%) for those respondents attributing a high importance to education. labs receiving scan files from more than 50% of clients do quote a lower than average increased training needs (76%), and a higher than average increase in productivity (89%). recently open labs do quote more often increased staff engagement (90%). labs producing a high share of traditional works more often quoted increased training needs (95%). what impact do you feel doctor digitization with intraoral scanners has had for your laboratory staff? top 3 ranking base: 594 cases lab needs in terms of business support actions to help the business grow 42 what do you think is going to help you grow your business in the future? - top 3 ranking competitive pricing is more often quoted by bigger sized labs (38%) and by labs producing ortho cases with aligners (38%). labs recommending medit and carestream ios state more frequently quality of work (79% and 77%). labs producing a high share of traditional techniques quoted more than average simplification of the workflow (58%) and so is for labs serving a low number of dental practices (54%). quality of work and simplification of the workflow are the most sought-after actions. labo in terms of increasing business, the possibility of increasing the level of quality of work (the possibility of doing more complex work) and the simplification of workflow seem to be priorities. in italy, workflow simplification and the possibility of providing technical support to dentists is of greatest interest. in the uk, the possibility of being able to strengthen the relationship with the dentist is one of the most important aspects, in addition to the possibility of shortening the production time of the finished work. base: 594 cases expected additional support and services 43 what additional support & services would you expect from digital providers side? (multiple choice) training / education and support are most quoted needs for additional services. dedicated lab support is more often quoted by bigger sized labs (64%) and in general by labs receiving higher than average scan files from clients and those equipped with milling unit (59%). lab-to-doctor education support is more often quoted by labs attributing a high importance to training and education (44%), by those receiving high shares of models/impression works to digitize (48%) and by smaller sized labs (46%). access to restorative design services is more often quoted by labs receiving a higher share of scan files (37%) and those producing a higher number of ortho cases with aligners (37%). access to modelling and interpretation services are more often quoted by labs with higher share of clients sending scan files (34%) and by those performing higher production of ortho cases with aligners (41%). commercial partnership is more often quoted by labs with high share of clients sending scan files (33%) and those less involved in traditional techniques (31%). labo in the uk the issue of dedicated laboratory support and access to restorative design services are the most relevant. in some countries more elements are mentioned, for example in spain and italy both training and support in providing a synergistic training path between laboratory and clinic is very important. in fact, dentists often turn to the laboratory for guidance on digital flow management. base: 594 cases lab needs in terms of training importance of training and education 45 how do you rate the importance of training and education? mean: 4,5 importance of training / education is very high throughout, even more so in southern europe. training / education is higher than average very important among smaller labs (65%). and so is for less recently open labs (64%) and for those receiving a lower share of scan files (70%). again, it is higher than average very important for those who think that ios scans have had a positive impact on the laboratory business (62%). where digitalization rate is lower, the perception that training is very important increases (expansion phase). labo base: 594 cases cases 137 114 125 113 105 4,4 4,1 4,7 4,7 4,3 attended type of trainings 46 what types of trainings do you attend? how often (no.

32 labo what is the brand of your desktop scanner? the desktop scanner shows the highest penetration in the dental labs. as previous surveys show, 3shape still is the most quoted brand among dental labs. dental wings and dentsply sirona still are present in the top quoted brands in overall, with top three penetration performance in several investigated countries. medit, showed an outstanding performance, and it proved to be among the most quoted brands, with top position in france and spain. 3shape was quoted more than average among labs with a higher number of dental technicians (more than 5 technicians: 44% vs 28% overall) but less than average in more recently open labs (from 2011 to 2021: 19%). on the other hand, medit is more than average quoted in recently open labs (from 2011 to 2021: 31%). germany france italy spain uk penetration 84% 84% 81% 71% 85% 3shape medit 3shape medit 3shape medit dental wings dental wings open technologies dentsply sirona dentsply sirona 3shape open technologies dentsply sirona medit cases 137 114 125 113 105 installed base top 3 ranking cad-cam milling unit brands is your lab equipped with a cad-cam milling unit? 33 labo what is the brand of your cad-cam milling unit? in the segment of milling units installed in the dental lab, dentsply-sirona still is the leading brand, thanks to the cerec system, with top penetration performance in france, spain and the uk. in comparison to the previous edition of the omnivision digital, it is worth noting an improvement of the penetration performance by imes-icore (focused on the production of milling units only), roland and ivoclar. also, it is clear that the market is mainly made up of players focused on the production of milling systems only: roland, imes-icore, amann girrbach, vhf, zirkonzahn. among this, only amann girrbach, zirkonzahn produce also consumables. germany france italy spain uk penetration 61% 51% 47% 44% 60% imes-icore dentsply sirona roland dentsply sirona dentsply sirona densply sirona roland dentsply sirona imes-icore roland amann girrbach imes-icore amann girrbach roland ivoclar cases 137 114 125 113 105 installed base top 3 ranking 3d printer brands is your lab equipped with a 3d printer? 34 labo what is the brand of your 3d printer?

this is also true for labs performing a higher-than-average number of ortho cases with aligners. currently, spain is the country with the lowest penetration of ios but with higher growth rates and in full digitalization process. labo the laboratories state that they are approached by dentists with a certain frequency. a frequent approach is considered to be 'monthly' to 'daily'. although the frequency of approach is fairly homogeneous between countries, spain and france show a higher-than- average overall frequency of 'monthly/weekly/daily'. base: 594 cases cases 137 114 125 113 105 23 recommended intraoral scanner brands when asked by the clinician, do you recommend a specific intra-oral scanner brand? which intra-oral scanner brand do you recommend most often? 3shape is quoted more than average among big sized labs (49%), by the lab owners (39%), less recently open structures and those stating the business has decreased (40% and 46% respectively). itero is quoted more than average among more recently open labs (25%) and among labs receiving a high share of scan files (22%). less than average among labs performing a high share of prosthetic complex cases (12%). medit is quoted more than average among labs receiving a lower share of scan files (23%). dentsply sirona is quoted more than average among labs receiving scan files from more than half of clients (20%). labo recommendation is very high: on an overall basis, at least 90% of the laboratories approached by dentists recommend a brand. 3shape is the most recommended brand in spain and italy, while itero is most recommended in the uk. carestream has adopted a very widespread distribution and commercial strategy, which explains the high number of recommendations in italy (achieving a significantly higher penetration than in the other analysed countries). diverse recommended brands across the surveyed countries: 3shape is most quoted, itero is main follower. why do you recommend the mentioned ios brand? (multiple choice) scanner performance and clinic / lab integration are the most quoted reasons. brand reputation is quoted more often among bigger sized labs (62%) and those performing ortho cases with invisible aligners (58%). the latter also quote community more often than average (20%). integration is quoted more often by labs serving a higher number of practices (60%).
1: key-stone omnivision digital europe 2015_executive_summary - 18 chart 19a and 19b. use of digital technologies breakdown by technology and channel europe in overall, it is also possible to analyze the information shown at slides 15 and 17 by crossing the data, whose results are shown in the following chart. the chart shows in the rows the information regarding the technologies (in-lab milling, scanner and full outsourcing). in the columns the information is related to both the channels and the technologies. the information can be read as follows: with regard to the technology users, out of the total scanner users (red circled data, respondents using a scanner to send the scan files outside for milling), in 11% of the cases they also have an in-lab milling at the laboratory, and in 10% of the cases they also send the models outside for milling (either to a manufacturer/milling center or a partner lab). on the other hand, with regard to the channel users, out of the total manufacturer users (blue circled data, respondents sending either the models or scan files to a manufacturer/milling center), in 91% of the cases they send the scan files to a manufacturer, in 11% of the cases they have an in-lab milling, and in 19% of the cases they also send their models outside for milling to a manufacturer. this is a kind of multiple answer question. also, the same information is available with the channels in rows, and in the columns there are again both the channels and the technologies. the information can be read as follows: with regard to the technology users, out of the total scanner users (red circled data, respondents sending their scan files outside for milling), in 85% of key-stone omnivision digital europe 2015_executive_summary - 19 the cases, they send the scan files to the manufacturer/milling center channel, in 44% of the cases they also send the scan files to a partner lab, and 11% of them also have an in-lab milling. on the other hand, with regard to the channel users, out of the total partner lab users (blue circled data, respondents sending their models or scan files to a partner lab), 48% of them also send their models or scan files to a manufacturer/milling center and 11% of them also have an in-lab milling. of course, this is a kind of multiple answer question as well.

it interesting to notice the change in the weight of the various items in comparison to intention to buy ranking 2015 too expensive 32% i dont need it 28% low demand 24% i prefer the traditional method 10% poor system precision 6% poor familiarity with technologies 4% other 2% dont know / no answer 0% labo digital technologies in laboratories breakdown by technology and channel labo digital technology use: breakdown by channel taking into considerations all the elements made with cad-cam systems, what percentage do you use the following supply channels? channels 84 base: 417 cases (digital restorations providers) percentage of laboratories among those who provide milled frameworks produced with the cad-cam technique, 50% send scans or models to other laboratories (partner-lab), while 49% send scans or models to one or more manufacturers or milling centers (manufacturer). since laboratories may use different technologies and channels, the sum of percentages is higher than 100%. labo digital technology use: breakdown by technology taking into considerations all the elements made with cad-cam systems, what percentage do you use the following technologies? technologies base: 417 cases (digital restorations providers) 85 percentage of laboratories among those who provide milled frameworks produced with the cad-cam technique, 41% use full outsourcing, sending the models to an external milling center (to other partner laboratories or manufacturers), 47% send scans to other laboratories or manufacturers and 26% have a milling unit in the laboratory. since laboratories may use different technologies and channels, the sum of percentages is higher than 100%. labo digital technology use: channels and technologies taking into considerations all the elements made with cad-cam systems, what percentage do you use the following technologies or supply channels? technologies and channels 86 base: 417 cases (digital restorations providers) for example, among those sending their scans in outsourcing, 83% of them address themselves to a manufacturer and 45% of them to a partner lab. for example, those addressing themselves to a manufacturer, in 18% of the cases they also have an in- house milling unit and in 32% of the cases they also address themselves to a partner-lab. percentage of laboratories the chart allows to evaluate the percentage of users of different channels, in comparison to the users of the same channels or technologies. the base refers only to the laboratories using the digital workflow to produce milled frameworks. please, see the example on the right. channels digital technology use: technologies and channels taking into considerations all the elements made with cad-cam systems, what percentage do you use the following technologies or supply channels? technologies and channels 87 percentage of laboratories base: 417 cases (digital restorations providers) for example, among those sending scans in outsourcing, 17% of them also have an in- house milling unit and 11% of them send models in full outsourcing. for example, those sending their models or scans to a partner lab, in 2% of the cases also have an in-house milling unit, in 42% of the cases use a scanner and in 64% of them send models to colleagues. labo technologies the chart allows to evaluate the percentage of use of the different technologies, in comparison to the users of the same technologies or channels. the base refers only to the laboratories using the digital workflow to produce milled frameworks.

given a rather low number of cases, it is recommended to consider the results as a qualitative indication. digital technology penetration digital technology use: breakdown by technology taking into considerations all the elements made with cad-cam systems, what percentage do you use the following technologies? technologies base: 405 cases (digital restorations providers) 66 percentage of laboratories among digital technology users, the most used technology is scanner and the most used way to provide digital restorations is to send scans to a manufacturer or milling center. 63% is the percent of scanner owners, out of the total digital restorations providers, who use the scanner to send the files outside for milling. in comparison to year 2015, scanner owners increased remarkably, along with milling center owners. on the other hand, the percentage of full outsourcing providers showed a relevant decrease. since laboratories may use different technologies and channels, the sum of percentages is higher than 100%. digital technology use: breakdown by technology taking into considerations all the elements made with cad-cam systems, what percentage do you use the following supply channels? channels 67 base: 405 cases (digital restorations providers) the manufacturer/milling center is the most used channel, with a 70% of users. percentage of laboratories in comparison to year 2015, there have been a relevant decrease of laboratories being supplied by partner labs, while the use of the manufacturer channel increased remarkably. since laboratories may use different technologies and channels, the sum of percentages is higher than 100%. digital technology use: breakdown by technology taking into considerations all the elements made with cad-cam systems, what percentage do you use the following technologies or supply channels? technologies and channels 68 percentage of laboratories base: 405 cases (digital restorations providers) for example, among those using a scanner, 35% of them also have an in-houose milling and 25% are full outsourcing users. for example, those sending their models or scans to a partner lab, 69% of them have a scanner for sending scans outside and 29% of them also have an in-house milling. the chart allows to evaluate the percentage of users of different technologies, in comparison with the same technologies and the different channels used. please, see the example on the right. digital technology use: breakdown by technology taking into considerations all the elements made with cad-cam systems, what percentage do you use the following technologies or supply channels? technologies and channels 69 base: 405 cases (digital restorations providers) for example, among those performing full outsourcing, 75% of them send the models to a manufacturer and 68% of them send the models to a partner lab. for example, those sending their scans or models to a partner lab in 29% of the cases they also have an in-house milling and in 64% of the cases they also send the scans or models to a manufacturer/milling center. the chart allows to evaluate the percentage of users of different technologies, in comparison with the same technologies and the different channels used. please, see the example on the right. percentage of laboratories brands numeric distribution and intention to buy digital technologies and cad-cam frame materials scanners: numeric distribution what is the brand of your scanners, including the one(s) possibly used with your milling unit? total scanners (330 cases) scans sent outside (242 cases) the numeric distribution is the percentage of clients that mentioned to use a certain brand, or to get delivered by a certain supplier. thats why it is comparable with the coverage index, it is a subjective value, related to the brand or supplier which is named by the clients as their brand or their supplier. open technologies have certainly increased their presence among the spanish dental labs, and dentsply sirona improved its position too. 71 in-house milling units: numeric distribution what is the brand of your milling unit? base: 139 cases (milling units owners) 72 the numeric distribution is the percentage of clients that mentioned to use a certain brand, or to get delivered by a certain supplier. thats why it is comparable with the coverage index, it is a subjective value, related to the brand or supplier which is named by the clients as their brand or their supplier. as for the milling units, vhf and amann girrbach have increased their performance over the last years. manufacturer milling centers: numeric distribution considering the scans and the models sent to manufacturers / milling centers, what is the name of those manufacturers / milling centers? base: 205 cases (manufacturer users) 73 the numeric distribution is the percentage of clients that mentioned to use a certain brand, or to get delivered by a certain supplier. thats why it is comparable with the coverage index, it is a subjective value, related to the brand or supplier which is named by the clients as their brand or their supplier. as regards the scans/models sent outside for milling, when comparing the results with the 2015 edition, it is interesting to note the spreading of specialized milling centers, such as ideas medical solution, while sineldent confirms its leading position among the centralized milling centers in spain. cad-cam frames materials: numeric distribution q: what are the brands of the cad-cam materials (blocks or discs) that you use with your milling unit, at your laboratory? q: considering the scans sent to partner labs, what brands of cad-cam consumable materials do your partner labs use? q: considering the models sent to partner labs, what brands of cad-cam consumable materials do your partner labs use? base: 84 cases (in-house and partner lab users) 74 processing without dont know / no answer the numeric distribution is the percentage of clients that mentioned to use a certain brand, or to get delivered by a certain supplier. thats why it is comparable with the coverage index, it is a subjective value, related to the brand or supplier which is named by the clients as their brand or their supplier. technology intention to buy are you planning to start providing fixed prosthesis elements produced with digital technologies (cad-cam / 3d printing) within the next year? 75 18% of those not performing fixed prosthetics using digital technologies plan to start within a year. this percentage increases among laboratories with three or more technicians (31%) and among those declaring a positive perception with respect to the future of their business (27%). if, on one hand, the intention to buy have increased remarkably in recent years - in 2012 only 7% of those not providing digitally produced prosthesis declared they would have done - with the wide spreading of the digital technology, still there seem to be a hard socket of those somehow adverse to it, as the very slight change from 2015 (16%) to 2018 (18%) demonstrates. the differences below +/- 2% should be considered not statistically relevant. base: 159 cases (not providing digital restorations) 2015: 25 cases intention to buy intention to buy technology intention to buy: why not are you planning to start providing fixed prosthesis elements produced with digital technologies (cad-cam / 3d printing) within the next year? if not, why?

chart use of digital technologies breakdown by technology with regard to the technologies used, the traditional impression is by far the most used one. 14% of the respondents use a chairside milling, and 11% of respondents stated to use an intraoral scanner with which they send the scans outside (to a partner lab or a manufacturer/milling center) for milling. key-stone omnivision digital europe 2015_executive_summary - 10 chart use of digital technologies breakdown by technology europe vs. breakdown per country the analysis by country highlights italy as the one with the highest penetration of intraoral scanners and chairside milling users among digital restorations providers. despite a low number of cases, uk shows a different behavior compared to the rest of the evaluated countries, with a higher than average percentages shown in the use of both intraoral scanners and chairside milling units. considering the reduced number of cases, this information can only be considered as an indication.

Based on the given material, which brand is recommended the most among labs receiving a lower share of scan files in Spain and Italy?
answer.1:
According to the chart provided, what percentage of European partner lab users also send their models or scan files to a manufacturer/milling center?

Answer: 
The chart provided in Document 0 shows that out of the total scanner users (red circled data) in Europe, 11% also have an in-lab milling at the laboratory, and 10% of them also send the models outside for milling (either to a manufacturer/milling center or a partner lab). Additionally, out of the total manufacturer users (blue circled data), 91% of them send the scan files to a manufacturer/milling center, and 19% of them also send their models outside for milling to a manufacturer. Therefore, it can be calculated that the percentage of European partner lab users who also send their models or scan files to a manufacturer/milling center is not explicitly mentioned in this chart. However, it can be estimated based on the information provided. Out of the total partner lab users (blue circled data), 48% also send their models or scan files to a manufacturer/milling center, and 11% of them also have an in-lab milling. Therefore, the percentage of European partner lab users who also send their models or scan files to a manufacturer/milling center is approximately 59% (48% + 11%). However, as mentioned earlier, this information is based on the chart provided and should be interpreted with caution due to the reduced number of cases.

ground_truth.0: The penetration of dental scanners in the sample of dental laboratories is 84%.
